reviewText:
As a huge fan of both the Alien's and Predator's franchise and of course the Alien vs Predator franchise, I decided to give this game a try and its actually not a bad game, for starters you get to play as both Alien and Predator and also as a marine which if you want the best gameplay as a marine, play in pitch black and listen to the motion tracker, being scared is the way to play it!

Now the story is rather short with the Alien story being the shortest and the Marine story being the longest, but the gameplay for each of the faction's is great, as an Alien you can virtually walk on any surface and then leap onto your enemies with of course darkness being your greatest ally. As a marine you can be scared with your motion tracker and being ready to shoot anything that appears, but my favourite faction is obviously the Predator, you can jump practically anywhere, you can use the combi stick and all the other cool weapons that a Predator has equipped, but the coolest thing about the Predator is that you can turn invisible! and then use that to sneak up on enemies and take their heads as a trophy! Each of the faction's has unique collectibles as well as a Nightmare difficulty which if you die, there is no checkpoint so you must restart the level.

The game runs really well from an optimization point of view, I was able to run the game at 60FPS! at 1080p with all the graphical settings including the Directx 11 exclusive options maxed out, unfortunately this game really suffers from screen tearing, even with V-Sync on the screen kept tearing constantly, more so for the Alien Campaign then others, but other then that the game is really good on PC.

Overall i really enjoyed the game and have had lots of scary moments on the Marine campaign while having fun tearing them apart on others, If you are fan of the series i would pick up the game and have some fun with it, there is Multiplayer in the game but the servers are dead and the ones you can get into are filled with hackers, so if you do get the game then I would Stick Around! to having fun on the Campaign.

reviewText:
I was very excited to play the Aliens VS Predator for the first time ever and it met my expectations to allow me to say its a good game. The enviornment is very well detailed, gameplay is accurate to the films, same with the sounds, campaigns are extensive and are well done; especially the Marine campaign.

Let's take a look at the negatives: The voice acting feels uninspired, AI on the marines is terrible, limited multiplayer content without the DLC maps, Multiplayer seems to be effectivly dead (and yes, I do have the dedicated servers installed, stop yelling at me.), only 2 survival maps without DLC, Predator's and Alien's cheap combos/moves in multiplayer, no female marines in multiplayer, cannot cancel executions (this leads to alot of cheap deaths in multiplayer since the animation takes 7-10 seconds to complete).

Despite all the game's negatives, Its still very good. I got it for $3.79 while it was on sale. I also bought it as a gift for a friend, and he loves Aliens Vs Predator.

I rate Aliens VS Predator with a 7/10         Until next review!                 Let's form up! ~Stealth 1548

reviewText:
As a single player FPS, this game is about 15 hours of non-stop fun. I'm sure it's even more fun if you're familiar with the three movie series: Alien, Predator and Alien vs. Predator, and their sequels. The game shows a lot of respect for the lore established in those movies and expands a little on it.

The aliens and predators look great. The music and sound effects are spot on. I found it impressive how the storylines of the three campaigns (marine, alien, predator) are nicely interwoven.

As you can imagine, the way to play each campaign is completely different depending on the species you play and their weapons and skills, but each campaign even has a different HUD that really fits the species, which adds to an already immersive experience.

You can adjust the difficulty to fit your play style and your (in)experience with FPS games. You can play the game with a gamepad, but I'm not used to the 'twin stick' thing where one stick moves your character and another stick moves the camera. So I quickly switched to mouse and keyboard, which was a lot smoother for me. You can bind keyboard keys for each species seperately in the options menu.

I haven't tried multiplayer but I gather from other reviews that multiplayer for this game is dead, so if you're looking for a good multiplayer FPS, I suppose you need to look elsewhere. This also means that steam achievement completionists will have a hard time because 12 of the 50 achievements require multiplayer action.

All in all, I'd recommend this game to anyone who reads this because that means you're at least remotely interested in FPS games or in the movies this game is based upon. But since three single player campaigns of about 5 hours each is all you'll get out of it, I would advise against paying full price for the game and instead waiting for it to be on sale.

reviewText:
Underrated.I really don't see why this game is so underrated. Yes, it's different from the previous AvP games, but that doesn't mean it's a bad. Yes, the story could be much, much more interesting, but you don't need it, when you can become a bloody predator! Yes, the AI isn't brilliant, and that is a big con. Yes, multiplayer isn't perfect, but the game has a lot to offer nonetheless. Beatiful graphics, nice gameplay, good level design - you will not be able to stop playing until you finish the story.

PROS:
Species      Description            Marine      Classic modern shooter/horror. Nothing extremely bad, but I don't have much to say about it.            Alien      I am an alien! Hssss...            Predator      Unless you play on easy/normal, you really need to think fast when you are fighting aliens. Killing humans is still easy - hard difficulty doesn't make them any more intelligent.
CONS:
Species      Description            Marine      Hmm... Could be more interesting if they added features like welding doors, working in team (with good AI, of course), installing/controlling turrets, etc.            Alien      Gameplay is repetitive. They could add evolution egg > facehugger > chestburster > queen and realistic hunting without this whole press E to win, and with good enemy AI.            Predator      Gameplay is interesting only on hard and hardcore. Humans are stupid as hell, and aliens are weak.
The multiplayer is unpolished, but it still is somewhat fun to play. Unless you meet a cheater, in which case you can't do anything.
My rating for AvP would be...
8/10

reviewText:
When this game first released, it was into a sea of hype driven fans of the franchise. They tore it apart based almost solely on the multiplayer at the time. Once the angry wagon was in tow, just about everyone jumped on. Everyone hated it, it sucked, don't buy it wait for colonial marines.  Comparisons of the multiplayer of the original AvP and this one exploded. Much like the entire L4D2 fiasco and boycott.

Well, ♥♥♥♥ multiplayer, K?

You want a beautiful game? This game is beautiful.
Do you miss the cheesy, campy sci fi writing of your youth? It's here.
Do you enjoy blowing ♥♥♥♥ up? Melting faces? Ripping peoples heads off through their STOMACH!? Yeah, this game has that.
Three campaigns, three interweaving stories, lots of fan service and and buckets of beautiful blood. This game is what, 15 bucks now? I spend more than that at McDonalds! Come on, if you're a big fan of the franchise you'll enjoy the single player. Give it a try, or are you to poor to ♥♥♥♥ away 15 bucks?

reviewText:
In my honest opinion 8.5/10

Singleplayer 9/10
Multiplayer 7.2/10
Soundtrack: 9.5/10
Horror/Fear: 7.9/10
Graphics: 10/10 (From it's release date standpoint)
Overall gameplay: 8.7/10


The singleplayer is extremely fun; for all three campaigns. No real cons there. Good stories on them all, even if two are left unsaid.

However the multiplayer feels a bit rushed; The predator is easily overpowered givne the high attack speed of their melee, strong heavy attack, at ability to easily run from a fight. Not to say the obvious; but the Plasma a Predator can use is extremely overpowered (One-Shot kill on a non-charged shot)

Playing as the Alien (Xenomorph) is easily the most fun part of this game; the ability to run, jump and climb on any surface at high speeds is a very unique experience (And fun.)

Playing as a Human is aimed more at fast-reaction FPS gamers, forced dim lighting; fairly limited ammunition, and sprinting too long will easily ruin your fun.

Playing as the Predator is essentially playing as a walking tank; Slow-moving, extremely tall, armed with dual blades that will tear you a new one, and a health bar to support a mini-boss battle from Dark Souls. Not to make it sound overpowered; they are easily killed if snuck up on or ambushed.

reviewText:
Aliens vs. Predator is a 1st person shooter that continues the tradition of the earlier Alein vs. Predator games. There are three campaigns, each starring a unique character. You can play as a Human Marine, Predator or Alien, and each character has their storyline and playstyle.

Having recently played some of Alien vs. Predator 2000, I knew a little of what to expect. What I was hoping for was a modernization of that game, because I found that while it may have been a worthy title in its time, it did not really stand up to the test of time in my opinion.  That is an issue with early 3D games and FPSs in general. This game delivered on that, and more so.

The first improvement to address is the tutorial. AvP 2010 gives you a short tutorial as an introduction to each character so you can become accustomed to the controls. I found myself quickly mastering the majority of controls, although walking up walls as a Xenomorph was still a bit tricky. Aiming your various weapons is easy enough, and the button placement seems to make sense.

The graphics are really fantastic for what is now a 4 year old game. This was a huge improvement from AvP 2000, and shows you just how far games have come in 10 years. Better graphics help add to the atmosphere, which can be downright scary at times as a Marine.

The voice acting and sounds are another high point. The beeps on your motion detector mixed with the gutteral sounds of your Alien attackers will begin to fill you with dread. The rave like scene of an early set piece really uses music well to add to the intensity.

With 3 campaigns, there is a lot of variety to this game not usually found in FPS games. I found that the Marine campaign played much like a Survival Horror FPS, the Alien campaign like a Stealth shooter, and the Predator campaign like an overpowered mixture of both. It really is quite an accomplishment that they could pull all of this off in one game. Being able to switch easily between campaigns after missions is a nice touch.

One thing to keep in mind is that Aliens vs. Predator is a licensed game. A lot of your enjoyment will be derived directly from that universe. If you enjoy that license, I can whole heartedly recommend AvP. It's an enjoyable FPS on its own accord, and you will love being able to play as all three species. If you are not a fan of Aliens and Predator, I'd still say this is worth a try. The concept is pretty unique, and the gameplay as the Alien is some of the most enjoyable I've experienced. You will, however, probably find that the story does not do much for you since it requires a bit of knowledge from the movies to fully enjoy.

Grade: B
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Developed at Rebellion by the team responsible for the original 1999 PC classic, the all-new Aliens vs. Predator allows players to take the role of three infamous species: Colonial Marines, Predators and Aliens. The game features a unique three-way online multiplayer experience, allowing gamers to battle for survival and the right to be crowned the deadliest species in the galaxy. Each race also has its own distinct action-packed single-player campaign mode, with a storyline that cleverly interweaves with the other two species’ paths. Set on planet BG-386; a human colonist mining group discovers an ancient pyramid containing a dark and horrible secret. Across the galaxy, a race of warriors is alerted to the discovery of their pyramid and a hunting party is dispatched to ensure that it remains sealed at all costs. Deep inside the ruined pyramid meanwhile, nature's deadliest species awakes from centuries of hibernation intent on finding new prey. The Colonial Marine's story is an incredible fight against all odds from horrors lurking in the dark. Surrounded on all sides yet armed to the teeth, the Colonial Marine represents humanity's last stand with the firepower to fight back. As the Alien, players discover what it's like to be the scariest, most murderous creature in the universe, with the ability to traverse any surface at lightning speed in order to get close enough to unleash its deadly claws, tail and teeth. A master of the hunt, the Predator grants the player an arsenal of exotic weaponry with which to stalk from the shadows. Earn the greatest honor by ambushing prey up-close, before butchering them for a gory trophy kill.\nI really enjoyed playing the Predator and the Aliens campaign, because I haven’t experienced that kind of gameplay in any other game yet. Everybody who likes a mix of horror and action should play Aliens vs Predator.\nGiven the garbage most fans have had to go through in recent years, including one luke-warm Aliens vs Predator movie, and the lack of any kind of game attention since Concrete Jungle, AvP is a welcome addition to the series. Yes, its not an A-List game by any stretch of the imagination, but it is still extremely fun for what it is.

reviewText:
People actually hate this game? Are you nuts?
Okay, lets back up a sec.

Lets talk about what it gets right.

Visuals are crisp and great to look at, the enemies look how they should and the enviroments are filled with a dark foreboding atmosphere that fits the two franchises very well. The Xenos and the Preds are represented faithfully to the source material and the setting and story are actually better than the first AVP movie. Yes the occasional AI teammate is painfully stupid and much of the voice acting is terrible. But it makes up for that with challenging difficulty and a short-but-sweet set of campaigns for each side. Multiplayer is alot of fun, it is terribly unbalanced and many times unfair but if you can look past that the multiplayer itself is fun to play. Overall this game is a decent addition to the franchises. Much better than a certain abomination made by Gearbox...

reviewText: Developed at Rebellion by the team responsible for the original 1999 PC classic, the all-new Aliens vs. Predator allows players to take the role of three infamous species: Colonial Marines, Predators and Aliens. The game features a unique three-way online multiplayer experience, allowing gamers to battle for survival and the right to be crowned the deadliest species in the galaxy. Each race also has its own distinct action-packed single-player campaign mode, with a storyline that cleverly interweaves with the other two species’ paths. Set on planet BG-386; a human colonist mining group discovers an ancient pyramid containing a dark and horrible secret. Across the galaxy, a race of warriors is alerted to the discovery of their pyramid and a hunting party is dispatched to ensure that it remains sealed at all costs. Deep inside the ruined pyramid meanwhile, nature's deadliest species awakes from centuries of hibernation intent on finding new prey. The Colonial Marine's story is an incredible fight against all odds from horrors lurking in the dark. Surrounded on all sides yet armed to the teeth, the Colonial Marine represents humanity's last stand with the firepower to fight back. As the Alien, players discover what it's like to be the scariest, most murderous creature in the universe, with the ability to traverse any surface at lightning speed in order to get close enough to unleash its deadly claws, tail and teeth. A master of the hunt, the Predator grants the player an arsenal of exotic weaponry with which to stalk from the shadows. Earn the greatest honor by ambushing prey up-close, before butchering them for a gory trophy kill.\nI really enjoyed playing the Predator and the Aliens campaign, because I haven’t experienced that kind of gameplay in any other game yet. Everybody who likes a mix of horror and action should play Aliens vs Predator.\nGiven the garbage most fans have had to go through in recent years, including one luke-warm Aliens vs Predator movie, and the lack of any kind of game attention since Concrete Jungle, AvP is a welcome addition to the series. Yes, its not an A-List game by any stretch of the imagination, but it is still extremely fun for what it is.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Aliens Coloniel Marines should have used this game as a touch stone for the level of graphical quality from the very very beginning of it's development.

This game shouldn't be confused with the formerly mentioned title, as the attention to details and the level of replayability as any of the 3 main races of the aliens universe is nigh impeccable and does the series a fair amount of justice as far as quality of gameplay goes.

The story all around isn't this games -strongest- point, sticking to some of the most heavy tread story cliches of the entertainment industry, but it still stands on it's own legs, supported by Lance Henrickson's support of the titles as Mr Weyland himself.

This is definitely a game I'd reccomend. I wish they would do away with the rubbish lobby-multiplayer in a belated patch and replace it with a more traditional PC  multiplayer where one can join/leave a dedicated host or server at will without the wait to find a group or squad. Which goes two fold with a couple -bigger- maps for survival modes.. It's 4 years old but it still graphically holds it's own to modern titles... an update or infusion into this older title could help bring some faith back to the disappointed fans who like myself, despised the insult that is Aliens: Coloniel Marines.

I give this game a 8/10 overall. Definitely worth a play through or two on each of the campaigns.

reviewText: The gameplay is fine enough, and the sides are definitely varied in ability and tactics, but the game does have a couple of issues.  The single-player campaign is very short, 5 missions of varying brevity per faction, and they aren't the best in quality.  The controls for the alien, especially if you have the auto-scale-walls option enabled, can take a very long time to get used to.  The multiplayer is almost dead - though there are people playing, it's comprised solely of those who have been playing this game non-stop since launch and are therefore much better than you ever will be.  If you want to be the allen there really isn't another modern option (Colonial Marines doesn't exist), but if you want to get it, get it cheap. 7.5/10

reviewText: This is one of he few games that can blend different characters, storylines, amd actions, to a t. You basically have three different games and storylines. The alien is pure stealth and speed, the marine relys on gadgets and guns, and the predator relys on techinal and stealthy assaults. Each character has a set of view modes (Pred - Heat vision, Marine - Nightvision), and a set of movement modes. The bosses are a bit easy, but definatly some challenging gameplay at some points.  I dont have a specifically high end computer, but the game looks and runs beautifully. Like night and day compared with console versions, which I also owned, and also returned the day after it came out. It just was very buggy and grainy on my ps3. Im glad I bought this for 4 $ on steam sale, or I would have went through my entire life thinking this game was trash. On pc though, this game can bring some pretty incredible gameplay experiences. If your looking for a cheap game, that lets you kil!!!!!! I recommend!

reviewText:
This game is FULL of potential and the gameplay is downright AMAZING.

Graphically, this game is stunning and drags you into the world of bloodthirsty creatures hunting you, just for the heck of it.
Gameplay wise you emerse yourself into the very movement of the Alien. NEVER, has I played a game where, after playing for 10-15 minutes, moving up and down the walls as an Alien is JUST as easy and normal than moving around as gravity accepts it.

Multiplayer: Blink - For a second and you will have 4 meters of tail piercing your body, blink for two and you will have your spine pulled from your body by a Predator.
Nothing feels better than giving the final blow to your prey, in this immersive game, full of potential.

Sadly the lack of players make this game a sad thing to play in multiplayer.

reviewText:
A well done action FPS game that seemed to slip through without being noticed by most people. Play as all 3 species, each with thier own story and goals.

Gameplay
The gameplay feels fluent and smooth. FPS drops were very few and far between on my medium end PC on high settings. You spend most of your time traversing through mostly linear levels completing objects along the way. In some areas objectives make you kill waves of enemies or solve puzzling problems such as figuring out how to enter a room, which helps keep that game a little more interesting rather than traveling through from place to place shooting everything in site.

Where controls are concerned, each species plays differently with thier own style of movement and controls and some are better than others. Playing as the marines feels like your typical FPS game, basically shoot your way through the level with a variety of guns. You feel more vulnerable as a marine as well as Aliens are very quick and come in hordes, and predators are much more powerful.

Playing as the Alien and Predator is where this game stands out from other FPS games. The predator has a variety of gadgets such as the laser cannon to fight from a distance as well as a spear and claws to tear your enemies to shreds up close. You are able to jump high and far using an ability, this allows the predators to have alot of verticality to combat. You can also go invisible to catch your enemies by surprise, however get to close and the humans with see through you camo. The Aliens are very quick and agile, while playing the Alien you are able to crawl up walls and leave very far. These contols are hard to get the hang of at first but once you get the hang of them you feel pretty deadly. You are quieter but all these perks come with a price, and that is your health. As the alien you will need to learn to be stealthy on your approach to clear rooms as well as know when to run and hide. Both of these species have special instant kill stealth moves and grab kills, however for as cool as they look, they also leave you very vulnerable to attack, their is also no way of cancelling this action and they take a few seconds to finish. If you are attacked during thease few seconds you will most likely die or barely get away.

Graphics
On high the graphics looked really good, they felt like real areas and fit the setting of the Alien/Predator universe. The levels are pretty well designed, and their is a variety of settings to traverse through as you go through the story such as the forest, ruins, structures and a few others. The gun fire flash looks good in dark rooms and the lighting is done very well adding to the spooky theme of some areas. The design and animation of the Aliens and Predators look well designed and look like their movie counterparts. The animation looks good, especially the Alien looks like it had a lot of work done to it to make it look and move realistically as it crawls over the walls. The animations during the stealth/grab kills are very well done and look badass and gory the way they should be in this style of game.

Audio
The audio is decent, although some of the guns sounded terrible and wimpy. The sound design during the levels does a pretty good job of making you feel on edge and adds a little bit to the suspense. The aliens sounded like the aliens from the movies however nothing special, same with the predator, you hear his significant and unique sounds but its nothing really special or new. The marines are terribly voice acted and their likes sounds cheasy.

For the most part the audio is decent and will add to the feel of the setting but nothing special.

Story
The story are different and each species has their own goal in mind however their is crossover between each story. As a marine you are trying to fight back the Aliens and find out what happened after a problem occurs in a research facility your goal is to find out what happened, where they are coming from, and how to stop it, but end up crossing paths with the predator down the line changing some of your objectives.

The Alien story line has you playing an Alien captured by humans and tested on. When the queen calls you seek to find her, only to be restrained by the humans, however after an issue arises during an experiment you are able to break the shackles that bind you down, allowing you to fight back, escape, and find your queen to learn why she is calling you.

The Predator story arc has you playing as a predator needing to prove himself to the elders to earn his right to be a hunter. This has you traveling through multipul areas killing Aliens in trials from the elders, through your trials you will cross paths with the marines leading for some objectives to become skewed as you destroy the resistance.

Summary
Aliens vs. Predator is a decent FPS action game that goes off the path from your basic FPS game. Being able to play as all 3 species with thier own unique abilities, movements and story arcs is fun and helps the game feel fresh. The story is decent, with some being better than others. They did a good job of balancing the characters out with thier own advantages and weaknesses making each species feel like it should. The world looks good and well designed. The controls feel good and tight, the only one that took a while to get used to was the aliens movements because of its quick pace and ability to climb on walls and other surfaces.

This is a good game that would be good to get on sale. Fans of first person shooters may enjoy the originality of playing as all 3 characters in this game, however if you are looking for a horror game, this may not be it. While it seems to try to be one, it doesnt seem to commit to the idea as the game progresses, at most this game may hit the creepy feeling at some points but thats about it.

I can not comment on the multiplayer as I never tried it myself, but for the most part from what I've heard is that its fun but almost always dead. So maybe with a few friends it could be fun for a get together.

reviewText:
This game is a hell of a lot of fun, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise.  You just have to make peace with its flaws.

Like in previous AvP games, the campaign is split into three parallel mini-campaigns, which intertwine in a fun and interesting way, allowing each species to use common elements of the setting's colonies and ruins in different ways for different purposes, and to different ends.  This may end up dissapointing some who will see the campaign as lazily reusing map assets so they don't have to tailor make levels for each character, but I find this complaint falls flat.  The level design smartly builds a unique playing space for each of the game's three species in each game level, something which must have taken much deliberation and iteration, whether or not you agree with the design decision.

Each storyline is really successful in acheiving a different feel and imparting a unique importance to each character;  The marine campaign is a terrifying account of a human just trying to stumble his way through this whole mess alive, the Predator campaign is full of bravado, badassitude, and honor, and the Alien campaign is all about essentially trolling the other two species in a deadly way and undermining everything anyone else is trying to acheive.  Of the three, the Alien's campaign is easily the weakest, although there is still a lot of fun to be had terrifying marines and pinning scientists to the ground for facehugger implantation.

The campaigns themselves are surpisingly challenging, though short.  I found that the difficulty of the singleplayer game is mostly fair, harshly punishing stupid mistakes, though your mileage may vary.  A huge part of the game is a keen awareness of your own limitations as a human, Alien, or Predator, and also a smart but controlled exploitation of your own advantages, leading to an experience that can get surpisingly cerebral for what otherwise presents itself as a big, dumb action game (and the story IS big and dumb). The checkpoint system in single player is bizarre and terrible, unfortunately.  This meshes incredibly poorly with how difficult the game can get, leading to moments I just wanted to give up and walk away from the entire game.

Ultimately, on the single player side of things, expect a dissapointingly short, dumbly written, but absolutely exciting and relatively unique (at least, in this day and age) romp through the built up mythos of all three species.

Multiplayer, unfortunately, is a bit of a mixed bag.  At the best of times, Alien vs Predator's multiplayer is just huge loads of fun.  It's action packed one moment, tensely silent another, and totally empowering the next, just before you realize you're outgunnned or outnumbered and you start running away from other players in terror.  Unfortunately, people's complaints about rampant stupid garbage in multiplayer are SPOT ON ACCURATE.  The different deathmatch modes highlight this game's unfun nonsense way more often than other, more mechanically interesting and unique game modes; unfortunately, TDM is far and away the most popular game mode, drawing in players for its simplicity and action.

Be prepared to scream impotently at your computer as you, a slavering, 7 foot horror from outer space leap at a hapless marine from across the room, only to bounce off and land stunned on the ground as if the guy were made out of steel and bolted to the floor, simply because he saw you or heard you and blocked.  Prepare to occasionally see marines beating predators and aliens in melee combat.  Prepare for plasmacasters still being rage inducing, even 13 years after AvP2.  Prepare, even, for a stealth kill mechanic that encourages players to just run circles around each other to see who can get enough of a glimpse of another player's back to hit the E" key and get an easy instakill.  At this point in the game's life

If you want this game, play it for the awesome singleplayer experience.  The Alien, the Predator, and the Marine all are unique and fun to control (although there's weird keybinds), but if you want to play online, don't.  The majority of the active community now are just angry people who exploit and hack the game in online lobbies.  You can see that in the discussions.  I don't even want to play online because of it.

I do highly recommend this game for the singleplayer.  But that's it.

Hell, somebody even offered me mods.  Sent me links and everything.  For god sakes.

reviewText:
Aliens vs Predator is a great game based on the Unreal Engine 3 focused on 3 main parts, 2 of them are 2 different types of stealth action and 1 survival horror (the marines, aliens and predators respectively). The game is always in the first person view, making it highly realistic but a bit confusing when running on walls and it takes some getting used to.

The sounds are highly emersive and very realistic, adding to the atmosphere of the game.

The graphics are very good (as already mentioned the game is based on the unreal engine 3 , so there isn't really a way to could look bad anyway ), naturally I found one or two places where the textures glitch out but those are random spots on the terrain where the majority of players wouldn't probably visit.

The gameplay is solid, the Marines campaign gets a bit tiring since it's pretty much a lot of the same. The aliens campaign is the best however the shortest, (you can't have your cake and eat it too) the predators campaign however kind of doesn't fit in... What I mean by that is that the entire battle between the aliens and humans doesn't really leave much space for the the predators story to develop, but then again I'm just nit-picking at a really solid title.

reviewText: This could be a lot better, but is definitely a decent game. The engine runs flawlessly smooth and never drops below 60fps for any reason whatsoever. The sounds are great and authentic, sounds just like the movies. Graphics are not bad. I had fun playing as the marine, kicking ♥♥♥ with pulse rifles and shotguns. The flamethrower is a disappointment because it is weak but I have never liked flamethrowers in games anyway. Playing as the predator rocks: you can pick aliens up and break them over your knee like a world champ, and tear marines heads off and their spines come out too. The alien is the only disappointing character in the game. It does not control so great and has very little actions. They just did not do much with the alien but then again wtf are you really going to do with something so basic? The last fight for the Alien has you killing three Predators and it just sucks.\n\nA pretty fun decent game worthy of a once-through. Would have been a lot better if they made playing as the Alien much better. Catch it on sale and only on sale. 7/10

reviewText:
For starters, the graphics are amazing. The graphics are over four years old and still it looks like it came out a month ago. The AI in the game is pretty good. Compared to its predecessor which, I won't mention, the AI in this game is godly. The Aliens climb walls as much as they can and they will stop at nothing to try to overwhelm you in Survivor mode. The weapons are simple. There is the default rifle, pistol, shotgun, sniper, and iconic Smart Gun. The Predator was very well redone from previous AvP games. Jumping has made it more movie accurate and realistic. The Alien was similar as in the other games. It can crawl on walls and see through walls, but one thing removed was the night vision which made it really easy for aliens to see in the dark as they could.

Pros
Amazing Graphics
Great AI
3 Campaigns in one
Cool Detailed Maps
Amazing Gamemodes
Doesn't Overwhelm you with customizable options
Sounds are indepth
Cheap Price

Cons
Multiplayer is almost dead
Shortest Campaign Ever
Not Enough Challenge in Campaign

reviewText: Amazing recreation of a classic game brought back to life with new technology and better resources. The game offers you mult segmented parts where you play between Marine, Alien, and Predator stories. Each segment may or maynot be tied into each other but you can play on as one character through all the way or switch between each character between missions. First person controls are great and all actions and aesthetics are a perfect match to the movies. aliens can cling to ceilings and bleed corrosive blood, Marines have motion detectors and flares to help locate threats, and the Predator has his multi functional mask and futuristic arsenal. Overall its a revamp of a classic that adds depth that newer games offer. The ambiance of a dark hallway can actually become a dark threat and a predator feels powerful but still outgunned. A must have for fans of either series!

reviewText:
AvP 2010 has very haphazard opinions if you google it on the internet. The general consensus of the title is that it's alright, but could have been better had the developers spent more time on it.

The single player portion of the game is where it shines the most. The three campaigns are alright, though their length is a primary concern. All three wont take you very long to complete, and this is particularly jarring since the previous two PC games AvP and AvP2 both had very long campaigns.

The biggest problem with this game is in it's multiplayer. The races are absurdly balanced, to the point where it's not enjoyable for anyone. The Predator is an overpowered demigod, the Marine can knock away Xenomorphs and the Alien is a fragile speedster that is fragile as ♥♥♥♥. This is possibly the biggest sin this game committed since AvP2 had amazingly good balance for it's three races. If you end up finding yourself in a multiplayer game all that ends up occuring is players spam the melee counter button.

Add in the lack of modding support (something that added longevity for AvP2), and lack of dedicated servers (For a series previously renowned for it's multiplayer clans) all you have here is one of the biggest examples of wasted potential. AvP2010 depresses me moreso because of how average the game is, and had they spent more time on it the game could have been the greatest in the series.

Thankfully it still isn't as bad as Colonial Marines.

reviewText: Amazing recreation of a classic game brought back to life with new technology and better resources. The game offers you mult segmented parts where you play between Marine, Alien, and Predator stories. Each segment may or maynot be tied into each other but you can play on as one character through all the way or switch between each character between missions. First person controls are great and all actions and aesthetics are a perfect match to the movies. aliens can cling to ceilings and bleed corrosive blood, Marines have motion detectors and flares to help locate threats, and the Predator has his multi functional mask and futuristic arsenal. Overall its a revamp of a classic that adds depth that newer games offer. The ambiance of a dark hallway can actually become a dark threat and a predator feels powerful but still outgunned. A must have for fans of either series!

reviewText: [E] GRAB
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
WARNING: This review is a little wordy!
ANOTHER WARNING: This review is applicable to the offline aspects of the game only!

This game is an interesting case. For a fan of the series, it's gonna be pretty entertaining and enjoyable. You'll probably finish it or at least play a good deal of it before it gets old. The reason I specify the requirement of being a fan of Alien/Predator is that you'll be interested enough in the fact that your favorite films are in video game form that you will ignore the shortcomings of the game. And there are many.
First off, the entire human campaign is god awful. Keep in mind, people, I still gave this game a thumbs up. The FPS mechanics are clunky, the guns are basically crap and in general you're super limited. It's as simple as that. Killing the xenomorphs can be an absolutely infuriating task to undertake, as they climb all over the walls and your terrible weaponry does stupidly limited damage. There are exceptions, of course, but you might find yourself dying repeatedly in the most annoying situations simply because the human as a character is too damn ♥♥♥♥♥♥. That being said, having xenomorphs as your enemies is kind of cool, and getting to splatter them all over the walls of spaceships is fairly rewarding.
Moving on, the xenomorph campaign is honestly very cool, provided you can master the challenging mechanics. The thought behind the movement and abilities of the aliens was solid. However, specifically in PC execution, this aspect of the gameplay must have been pretty damn hard to make a reality. Long story short, it can be pretty damn hard to effectively control a xenomorph in this game. Still, being able to move super fast and climb all over walls and the ceiling to destroy people is attractive, especially if you're a movie fan. (Who doesn't admire the killing potential of those things?)
The predator campaign is both the weirdest and in my opinion, the most fun part of the game. As the dreadlocked killer you can utilize a decent variety of weaponry, ranging from technologically advanced to downright brutally simple. The potential, again, is there. Once you get the hang of all the damn keys you have to push to actually accomplish anything, you'll definitely have a blast with this guy. The really unfortunate parts of the predator lie in two areas, completely unrelated. First, you're too f**king weak. If the only human to beat a predator was the Governator himself, (I live in CA) then there should be no reason why a few bullets from incredibly stupid human AI should be killing you so damn effectively. By contrast, the predator makes short work of xenomorphs. Just don't get spotted, I guess. The second problem in my eyes is the fact that the killing animations, while cool, are few. Once you (spoiler alert) rip out the spine of 10 soldiers in a row, it can get kind of old.
All of the above considered, and being a fan of the films and the universe, I maintain that this game is pretty damn fun. It's violent enough and at some points, even nerve racking enough to enjoy for a few dozen hours. I put about 20 hours into this game before I dropped it, so I figure you're paying about a dollar per hour if you pay at my average pace. That ain't too bad. If you want a game to play for a few days and you got a couple bucks, buy it. If it's ever on sale, definitely pick it up!

NOTE: You will still be much better off with Alien Isolation, sacrificing the predators for a much more developed, graphically intense, legitimately scary and more successfully story driven experience. Unfortunately, that game is still priced at $9999 on Steam. One day, people. One day.

reviewText:
An amazing game both for campaign and the multiplayer! Works perfectly with the XBOX controller for windows and I found the controls easy to use. Game runs smoothly, though I recommend for less lag turning down the resolution. I noticed when I was playing the campaign, it would lag a bit and some enemies seemed to teleport by the time I would try to shoot them; I would end up dying because of this.

The story for each campaign connects and you get 3 different views on it! I found it to be engaging and fun. An experience you will never forget!

As for online, I know many people were worried about not many people playing on the servers, but when I went on there were various servers to choose from. People still play this a lot! Especially since it is on PC. If you are playing the console version, yes, the servers might be dead, but PC? That hardly seems to be a problem.

If anything, join groups to find others who frequently play online.

Highly recommend if you are looking for an action game with some scares in it! (Marines campaign is the scariest)

reviewText: Although this game doesnt compare to the original AvP1 (Gold Edition) and AvP 2, this game is pretty much fun on its own. You get to play as three of the original species in the AvP universe: the xenomorph, the predator, and the humans. Probably the most fun I've had is playing as the Predator and sneaking up behind human and gutting them.  Shooting aliens is also very fun as the marines too.  The only thing I disliked was the fact that when you climb walls as the Alien you will get a major headache and this game lacks the CROUCH control!! Really... a FPS game that lacks crouching!?!?! Overall, this game is fun if you are a big fan of the AvP universe, the graphics are nice, and the environment is great too.  Sooo are you guys ready to GET TO THE CHOPPPPPAAAA!!!!""

reviewText:
Such a strange game, but truly a memory to remain. Offering a great approach to asymmetrical gameplay, AvP allows what few games will ever dare : True choice.

Want to run and gun, CoD style? Humans for days.
Got that freaky side that loves to tease your friends? Aliens ♥♥♥♥♥♥ 'ery body out there.
Are you the killjoy that your friends murmur about with sharp disgust? Yeah, Predator's know that feel. They got you.

All in all, a diverse experience. Even if you don't care for multiplayer, then you still have the THREE campaigns to play. Each incredibly different, you'll get to enjoy your pick of a horror, action, or even a stealth-focused campaign. As a biased player, I still must beg you, my unfortunate reader, to truly consider the human campaign.

It's like the Michael Bay's version of Alien: Isolation.

You need this in your life.

9/10, would get dismembered/anally probed again.

reviewText: As a fan of the Alien franchise as well as the Predator, I personally think this is a great game. This game puts you in the eyes of your favorite species: Xenomorph, Predator, and Colonial Marine, all with unique characteristics and abilites. Xenomorphs can traverse on walls  and sneak up on enemies only to tear their head off. Predators can go invisible for a short time and have thermal optics to better see enemies, slashing them to bits. And Marines, well.. they have guns. Being able to play as all 3 species puts a whole twist on the franchise, and allows people to finally realize what it feels like to be a bloodthirsty Predator. While this game is old, it is still a classic. My one and only complaint is that the campaign is rather short for all the species. You basically play for awhile completeling various objectives, fight a boss, then switch species. It can be over quick, but still very enjoyable. If you enjoy the movies, you'll love the game.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
First, while I admit this game isn't as close to being as good as the one developed in 2001 (AVP 2), it does have some perks, but I'd give this game a 7/10 for effort.

Perks:
1)  Great atmosphere, you will get some level of fear playing as the marine (which is where the main story is)
2)  Predator and Alien campaigns are pretty well done, while adding depth to the species
3)  Enjoy the limiting of the marine's weapons, requiring you to make valid and calculated choices.
4)  Lance Henrickson . . . enough said
5)  Fighting off an alien hive in an adult bar . . . epic and scary at the same time.
5)  Being able to attack the Preds with a cohort of Xenomorphs.

Flaws:
1)  The melee combat for humans?  WTF is a pistol whip going to do against a Xeno or Pred about to shaft you?
2)  Predalien that can hop through lava?  Come on, downing the queen early on was more plausible, as was the Praetorian.
3)  Voice-less main character?  In this age of story-telling, having a silent protagonist is kinda lackluster to the product.
4)  Doesn't seem to be enough fear and suspense in some areas for a game based on two classics of the same genre.

So, while I give the game props for decent level design and graphics, along with some interesting play options . . . it's kinda lackluster for the series compared to the two originals.  I recommend this game to those who truly love the series or like the potential in the multiplayer . . . other than than, it's kind of a meh level thumbs up.

reviewText:
Aliens vs Predator 3 is one of my all time favorite games. It is very under-rated. Ill give you a basic run down of the game.

PREDATOR: He is my personal favorite. Movies and games,the predator is like the ultimate hunter. He is very powerful, when taking down marines this can require patience if there are mutiple of them. The predators advantages consist of his health, his weapons, and his claw speed. For his health he has the most health in the game. Him being the biggest one of the three this is not suprising. His weapons are godly poweful. He has four weapons. The campaign starts you with them in this order. Plasma caster, Mines, Smart disc, and Spear.  The plasma caster is a very powerful weapon. If you charge it long enough if it hits it is an automaic one hit. The plasma caster automatically predicts where youre target is going to go and fires there. The proximity mines are essentialey plasma clamores that detect in all directions. This is most effective against marines as they arent fast enough to escape one if they set it off. The smart disc, my favorite weapon, Is a edged disc that is guided by the laser on your mask when you throw it. It can bounce off of walls an absured amount of times and make the enemy ♥♥♥♥ their pants. If it hits the body it leaves any species with one light melee attack left in them. On hitting the head the target will instantly die. This works against predators often as their head is pretty big. Now finally for the spear. I feel like this one would have made first if it werent for my love of the disc. The spear is a skillshot weapon that can miss often. If it does hit it is a guaranteed kill. That is it for the predator other than the fact that it is harder to knock him down and while his light atack is slower than the aliens his heavy attack is much faster.


ALIEN: The alien is a more aggressive charcter in general. The alien has only its melee, to make up for this it has the most mobility in the entire game. It can climb on any surface. Its heavy attack is an insant if they are on the wall. It wont do full heavy attack damage if you dont hit them in the head. If you do manage to hit them in the head they are pretty much screwed. As it stuns and does alot of damage. A second tail will usually kill them. The alien can be very prone to dieing if they fight up too close to their target and make their approach obvious. The alien has the second most health in the game. In melee combat what they have superior to the predator is their light attack is much faster. Their heavy attack although slower stuns longer. Their finishing moves AKA grabs are usually faster. This can be an upside or a down-side depending on how you look at it, but the alien automatically regenerates health.


MARINE: The marine is sterotyped as the worst character in the game. He is not. The reason his seems to be is he is very difficult although when mastered is a hell hole to deal with. The marine has the lowest health and mobility. The marine fights with guns.
GUNS:
Pistol: It is his weakest weapon although it has unlimited ammo.
Pulse rifle: It is his auto-matic assult rifle. It is the all around weapon. It has alot of ammo its mag size being 99. Jesus. PS You also get to start with this is multiplayer when you spawn. Its secondary fire is a grenade. AKA Noob toob for cod players.
Shotgun: If you have enemies that like to pounce at you instead of blocking try to hit them with this last second. The shotgun is a very up-close weapon its secondary fire is a buckshot that will stun and instakill if close enough.
Sniper: My favorite weapon. If you hit all shots in the body it will three hit. Don't let that fool you into thinking its bad. Its semi automatic so this seems op to some players. The second shot will stun too. If you hit an alien or predator in the head they will be stunned so finish them with one more bullet as headshots will leave them with low enough health to die to this.
Smartgun: The marines last but not least weapon. This is like a minigun except with a square on your screen that it has aimbot in. This thing is the bain of predator players. It will detect them while they are invisible. The only downsides to this weapon are having low ammo. Cant run while holding it and it takes up two weapon slots.

In my oppinion this is one of the most under-rated games of all time. This game derserves so much love that it doesnt get. The only thing that ruins my fun is hackers which arent too common but you will see one of you play this enough. I want you to try this game. Its not even that expensive. To me if it were 100 dollars I would still get it. I hope you have fun in your journeys of this game! Bye bye!

reviewText: Multiplayer is still up. Play with friends, make new friends. I've made about 7 friends playing this game, and at the same time I've had countless Game Nights with friends too. We love to just run around, killing each other a multitude of times in a number of gruesome ways. Play predator? Sneak up behind a human player and rip their head off infront of their teammates. Play Alien? Rush the enemy players with your fellow bugs and even as your numbers fall, your blood kills the enemy. Play Human? Prepare to ♥♥♥♥ yourself as you run in a group, making sure to keep one another alive while making sure you survive. The game is great, the storyline for each race is decent, and the multiplayer gamemodes are just wonderful.

reviewText:
This game is amazing! All the unique factions, weapons, skins, and gamemodes make this game an awesome fps!

Single Player: The single player is a basic campaign mode. There are three different campaigns, each about 3 hours long. You can play the Alien campaign, Marine campaign, and Predator campaign. It's cool how all these stories are connected but with different perspectives.

Multiplayer: The multiplayer is a standard fps online multiplayer. You can play as the 3 different factions, play all sorts of unique gamemodes, and level up to unlock skins for your factions. As a marine, you use guns and grenades to eliminate your enemies. The guns are a pulse rifle, pistol, shotgun, sniper rifle, flamethrower, smart gun, and rocket launcher. Playing as a marine is a basic fps basically. The Alien faction is a speedy faction which can climb up walls, go in vents, and do parkour. They use their tails, claws, and stealth takedowns to elimenate enemies. The Predator faction uses all sorts of weapons and gadgets. Spears, missile launchers, and razor blades. Predators can also cloak and use heat vision. It is pretty easy to find a server, and a decent amount of people play.

Gameplay & Modes: The game is basically an fps. The factions are balanced with unique skills and skins. In the campaign, there are many stealth missions which you have to use stealth and takedowns to eliminate enemies. The modes are species TDM, TDM, DM, and Domination.

Skins & Leveling Up: As you play AVP multiplayer, you will rank up depending on how good you do in a match. You gain xp by getting kills and doing awesome stuff, and the ranking system is basically just COD's ranking system. As you level up, you will unlock skins to make your characters look awesome. The max rank is 99.

10/10

reviewText:
Story  Aliens vs. Predator has a very short and sweet intertwining story between Aliens, Predators and Marines. So with that said, you play as all 3. If you've seen the Aliens VS. Predator movie, you're stepping into the same idea. There really isn't anything special about the story in any of the 3 campaigns but the best one is Marines in terms of this.

Gameplay Each character you play as has their own unique set of skills and weapons. Marines are able to use an assault rifle, shotgun, grenades and pistols. Predators have their scanners, claws, stealth mode, distraction (this obviously won't be in multiplayer), plasma cannon, discs, polearms and mines. Aliens just use their claws and tail and rely on the shadows and speed to gain their kills. Aliens are easily the hardest as they have very little defense and health, but this makes them very fun.

Multiplayer Multiplayer in Aliens VS. Predator is among the most broken if not the most broken multiplayer system I have ever seen. I went into multiplayer expecting maybe a little bias towards predators and aliens and thinking maybe it would feel slightly unfair until you got the hang of things.....but there is clearly very little if any skill involved being a Predator. You have to rely on your set of skills as each class like in the campaigns, only Predators have no limit to their gadgets. They don't have to wait for a recharge or take their time to aim their charged shots and so all you will see is them camping up on buildings and using their auto aimed plasma cannons. In the event that they do come and fight you face to face, marines cannot knock them back or stun them making them virtually impossible to kill unless you aren't spotted. As an Alien, it's best to work in numbers like they naturally do. Aliens are fun to play and you can defend against them as a predator or marine making the battles with them even. And you already know that predators can just use their plasma cannons to home in on you nearly instantaneously. Basically, if you want to enjoy multiplayer do not play as the marines unless you're a masochist as they're slow and easy targets. Stick to Predator and Alien for the multiplayer experience and you will have fun.

Graphics and sound  This isn't a new game but the graphics and sound are very well done. The only thing that will annoy you is hearing the marines say the same few lines over and over again. But this can be overlooked as the game is fun to play.

Overall Singleplayer will take you about 6-7 hours getting through the 3 small campaigns. Apart from the ridiculous balance issues and frustration that followed realizing this, the game is solid and is fun as an alien or predator in multiplayer, and all 3 are equally fun in the campaign. I just wish singleplayer could've been a lot longer. Recommended on sale.

reviewText:
Incredibly fun game! In fact, this is my second favorite AVP game(The first being AVP2, which unfortunately isn't available on steam) The graphics are incredible and each of the three single player campaigns are quite long, and let's you choose to play as either Alien, Predator or Lunch. In fact, each is like a game in and of it's self! My favorite Campaign is the Alien campaign....it's ALWAYS the alien campaign!

In fact, if I were told to find fault in the game I would be very hard pressed! The game is very well polished as far as FPS titles goes. It's very well fleshed out, and I am quite pleased! I guess though I would like to see the game more active in the online area. However I am more interested in the SP aspect of games, the Multiplayer capabilities is just an added bonus(unless it's a co-op mode...i love those).

If you love Aliens(or Predator), and love a solid story driven single player experience, then I highly recommend this game! If you are only interested in Multiplayer then you might want to reconsider due to the few people who do play online.

reviewText:
I really enjoyed this game.
1. The three campaigns feel unique
-Alien is more of a stealth game but combat is viable
-Predator is a mix of stealth and combat and ranged combat
-Human has a little horror element and just some fps fun
2.The story is good
-All three campaigns are intertwined with each other
3. The areas fell nice in all of the campaigns
-Many of the areas you will see in each campaign, but depending on which character you are you will treat the same area differently
4. The animations are really nice
- Especially the execution animations
Cons of this game
1. The campaigns are short
- I finished the entire game in 11,4 hours (did not get all collectibles played on normal difficulty)
- The Alien campaign is the shortest
- The Predator is the second shortest/longest campaign
- The Human campaign is the longest
2. The A.I. can be a little derpy at times but not often
3. The controls are a little wierd
- You can rebind the keys if they don't fit your fancy
Overall I would give this game a 7.5 out of 10

reviewText:
First, while I admit this game isn't as close to being as good as the one developed in 2001 (AVP 2), it does have some perks, but I'd give this game a 7/10 for effort.

Perks:
1)  Great atmosphere, you will get some level of fear playing as the marine (which is where the main story is)
2)  Predator and Alien campaigns are pretty well done, while adding depth to the species
3)  Enjoy the limiting of the marine's weapons, requiring you to make valid and calculated choices.
4)  Lance Henrickson . . . enough said
5)  Fighting off an alien hive in an adult bar . . . epic and scary at the same time.
5)  Being able to attack the Preds with a cohort of Xenomorphs.

Flaws:
1)  The melee combat for humans?  WTF is a pistol whip going to do against a Xeno or Pred about to shaft you?
2)  Predalien that can hop through lava?  Come on, downing the queen early on was more plausible, as was the Praetorian.
3)  Voice-less main character?  In this age of story-telling, having a silent protagonist is kinda lackluster to the product.
4)  Doesn't seem to be enough fear and suspense in some areas for a game based on two classics of the same genre.

So, while I give the game props for decent level design and graphics, along with some interesting play options . . . it's kinda lackluster for the series compared to the two originals.  I recommend this game to those who truly love the series or like the potential in the multiplayer . . . other than than, it's kind of a meh level thumbs up.

reviewText: This Game Needs a Sequel NOW!!!
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Time to update an old review! Oh boy here we go, a 2010 title and yet here I am 6 years later loving it to death. To put it quite simply, this is an amazing game for its time. Id say that for an attempt to make not only the alien and predator come together, but add in marines to the mix for an amazing 3 way bloody orgy? They did an amazing job. Once more, this is my review on the game and with my love for the Alien and Predator series, this review may seem bias. However I will do my best to give an honest review. So ready to kick this off? Lets do it!

Today were gonna do something different, were gonna start with the cons of the game. Why? Why not, and no Im not starting with cons because they outweigh the pros. I just want to go ahead and spill the beans on what may potentally ruin this game from being well...one of the greatest.

Cons: The multiplayer is DEAD. Thats the biggest con I can think of truth be told. The game is 6 years old, yes, but the multiplayer was dead within the first year of the game coming out. Sadly that might have been the death of this game all together. There are plenty of modes to play from, such as hunted and infestation. TDM and even flat out DM, which would pit alien on alien, predator on predator, and marine on marine. Of course like I said before, it was a massive bloody orgy so all 3 would still fight eachother. If this game was still alive, the multiplayer would certainly be worth playing.

Some weaponry. I say some because Im talking specifically about the flame thrower and smart gun. The smart gun was literally just an aimbot in the hands of a marine. Cloaked predator? They can see you. Alien hiding in the dark? They can see you. Now the flamethrowers only problem is the after burn, as an alien I have little to no clue to get rid of it other than sprinting fast down a corridor and hoping the fire stops. As a predator you have the ability to heal so Im sure that may negate the whole burning thing.

As far as cons go, thats about it. Now for the good stuff, right?

Pros. The story, well, the story as far as campaign goes, is something that I loved to play over and over. All three stories overlap yet none of the 'main characters' never really meet up. The alien story follows an alien who has been in captivity since birth and escaped when Weyland opened up the predator temple underground, he then aims to free his queen and make a hive. I wont speak any endings so no spoiler alerts. The predator story consists of a predator going onto the planet to find out what happened to a team of young bloods, and honor his code. Lastly the marine story is to contain the xenomorph outbreak in the colony.

The multiplayer (While it was alive I mean). Back when the game came out me and my good buddy played a ton of multiplayer and honestly? It was one of the funnest things to do. Mostly TDM since it was two teams that could consist of any combination of marines, aliens, and predators.

I think I gave the rough and short of it, truthfully its a great game single player wise and if the multiplayer wasnt dead (Boy Im just running that into the ground, arent I?) that would be another great thing from the game. Even for a 6 year old game, Id still go give it a try if you even enjoy the AvP series.

reviewText:
First off, don't let my play time fool you... I've owned this game on the PS3 and 360 and finished it both times while playing a hefty dose of multiplayer too.

To Keep this short and sweet - stick it on Nightmare mode and enjoy. Nightmare mode on the Marine campaign offers incredible pants-browning moments and the in the Alien and Predator campaigns you really get a sense of accomplishment taking down a group of Marines/Synthetics. Nightmare mode makes you really reconsider how you play the game - being stealthy as a Xeno/Pred and cautious as a Marine is all the more important and can really make you feel as though you are staying true to their movie portrayals.

As for multiplayer - I would recommend you stay clear. The Predator is OP'd and you will find a lot of terrain exploitation going on which, in the end, just frustrated me to the point I didn't enjoy playing anymore.

Graphics are much better than console counterparts in DX11 mode, while Atmosphere and gameplay more than make up for it's shortcomings in it's story.

Worth the purchase.

reviewText:
AVP (2010) has nice graphics, good sound design, solid atmosphere, and an interwoven story for Human, Xenomorph and Predator species spread across three campaigns.  The campaigns can all be beaten in about 10-15 hours of play total - give or take some hours based on your proficiency and desire for achievement hunting.  And it has difficulty settings, xp for rankings, and blah blah blah...

The story isn't bad, but it really only serves as an excuse to move you through each of the rather linear mission areas.  Every species receives communication from a leader that sends them from objective to objective until the mission area is complete and you can move onto the next one.  The story environs allow you to experience the inside of a hive, a colony base, and an ancient Predator pyramid amongst ruins in a tropical jungle.  You'll encounter several variations of Xenomorphs,  Predators, and Androids - SPOILER:  They all want to kill you.

As each of the species have different abilities - the playstyle for each is completely different.  Xenomorphs can climb on almost all surfaces, leap at enemies (also vents), claw at enemies, whip them with their tail, and bite into their heads.  They can also harvest" enemies by grabbing them and allowing a facehugger to attach.  Xenomorphs specialize in stealth and speed and to that end they can hide in vents
recommended: destroy lights which helps them hide in the dark

reviewText: В игре игроку представлены три различные кампании для одиночной игры за каждую из сторон конфликта. Люди предоставят в распоряжение игрока лучших из лучших – американский десант, который экипирован и снаряжен. Хищники обладают высокотехнологичным оружием и непревзойденной маскировкой. Чужие – уникальные по своей природе и характеру, не имеют никаких технологичных и искусственных приспособлений и оружия, только то, что дано природой. Интересные многопользовательские режимы и карты. Моя оценка 10\10.

reviewText:
Aliens versus Predator, the 2010 edition. Or so we could have hoped but unfortunately this is not as much a reboot of the extremely well made original as it an entirely new take on the franchise. Some features and concepts familiar to old players make a return but unfortunately the game only plays them lip-service and this new AvP game ends up feeling nothing like the original.

The AvP campaign takes place on a remote colony where Weyland-Yutani, in another instance of completely brain meltdown, finds a captured queen and immediately begins breeding aliens for the glory of scientific discovery, or something. As expected, the aliens get lose and start making a mess of things so the colonial marines get sent in to clear up the mess. Also a bunch of Predators show up because well, that's what they do.

All the campaigns share the same maps like in the original and they are simply approached from different angles. Unfortunately they are far more linear and closed off than in the original. There are very few vents for the alien to use and you only rarely have the option to skip killing someone.

The Marine campaign is obviously the one that has had the most effort put into it with plenty of voice-acting and even some audio diaries to be discovered around the complex that tells the story leading up to all hell breaking loose.
Most of the Marine gameplay is more survival horror than straight up shooter with a few boss fights and Hold the line!" scenarios to break up the mold every once in a while. Unfortunately both the survival and horror elements dissipate quite quickly
date: limited regeneration and being able to survive quite a few hits from the aliens make fighting them trivial and the biggest threat to you is killing one of them at close range and getting splashed with their acidic blood. All of the alien encounters are scripted and you are almost never surprised when they show up. Your one fight with Predators is easily forgotten and the only real challenge comes from Weyland's combat androids simply because they can one shot you.\n\nThe Alien campaign is somewhat more entertaining
recommended: with you stalking your prey and taking them out
hoursPlayed: one by one. The extremely linear maps and the low number of airducts available means this is nowhere near as well made as in the original however and you'll find that stealth is not quite as rewarding as it should be.\n\nThe Predator campaign however is where the game truly fails. Despite ostensibly being the strongest of the 3 species he depends almost 100% on stealth kills for half the game
voteText:
barely being to survive a burst from a marine or a few stabs by an alien. The famed shoulder mounted energy launcher holds 2 shots before it has to be recharged. About half-way through the game however you will come across your combi-stick and never use another weapon again. It one shots everything and doesn't de-cloak you making the rest of the fighting trivial.

The multi-player is nice but unfortunately nobody plays it anymore and getting a game going requires an enormous amount of patience.

All in all
helpfulPercent: Aliens Vs. Predator 2010 is a classic example of a game that takes it's roots from a great old game but doesn't understand any of the concepts it's trying to use and in the end it's not much more than a mediocre mess."

reviewText:
Что если смешать 2 вселенные? Получается новая, более закрученная и опасная. Чужой против хищника тому пример. Игра представляет 3 разные компании на одной планете но с разными взглядами. Сюжетные линии персонажей всё время переплетаются.
Чужой-мрачный, страшный. Любит темноту и жёстко расправляется с жертвой, не то что хищник но тоже больно) что его отличает от всех это смена плоскости, с этим не поспоришь.
Хищник-охотник, настоящий охотник, может быть невидимым, запросто крутит бошки противнику.
Десант-ну тут и таквсё сказано. Десантник вечно чего боится, но это только главы 3, дальше типичный кал оф дути с аптечками. В целом игра не плоха, поклонникам тем более советую

reviewText: The campaign is short and boring, but the real fun is in MP. The animations of fights are made really nicely and I've really enjoyed unmerciful battles. The best mod is classic DM, where fight all the 3 races. Mainly on the map Refinery, there is a hell if you play on some full server. I preferred to play with a marine, but the other races are funny as well. Predators are easier to learn because to play well with the Alien is seriously hard. I recommend this game to the fans of AvP series, but I think that beginners in the universe can have a fun too because the game is very underrated.

reviewText: love this game
voteText: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The highly acclaimed British developer Rebellion is striving to scare the hell out of you again with the new Aliens Vs Predator game. Re-capturing the pulse pounding game play from the original PC gaming classic, players once again get to play three different campaigns from three different perspectives. Aliens Vs Predator is a thrilling gaming experience no matter what part of the campaign you play. The clash this time around takes place on the deep space frontier world being colonized by humans. There on the the colony on a far off planet an ancient pyramid is found. Of course scientist and archaeologists can't help but go exploring this historic find. This of course triggers the ultimate confrontation between Colonial Marines, Aliens and the Predators.

The single player of the game is a rather unique playing experience.You can play any of the three species, each with strengths and weaknesses. The Colonial Marines, while rather fragile, they have a heck of a lot of fire power. The Predator has it's stealth and cloaking device, and the Aliens have the claws, the speed and numbers. Each character type requires a different skill to play to it's full potential. It all comes down to the skill of the individual players really.

The Colonial Marine makes due with the human technologies, from pulse rifles and pistols and auto turrets to motion trackers. The over all feel of survival horror and thrill when dozens of Aliens start clambering at you from every possible angle is exhilarating. Moving along through the darkness with only your beam of light illuminating small portions of an area is such a thrill.

The Predator is pretty awesome to play,I mean really who did not long for a game with this character after seeing the films? All the Predator equipment is at your disposal here, from the personal cloaking device which aids you in your stealthy approach to human targets, on to the unique ability to target a Marine and then throw a recorded mish mash of a voice to a point where the target will go investigate. This is perfect for luring target's out of a much more dangerous group. They will not fall for this tactic though if they are on alert. Predator also has it's view modes, each species has a special view mode that can spot them best. For instance if the player is in a view mode for hunting Marines, they have to take care because the Aliens are next to invisible in that mode. Getting around as the Predator is achieved by the standard running around...but what's fun is that the Predator has a focus jump mode - a circle representation of where you can jump to shows up, then hitting the right button and off you go. One would think the Predator would be the be all end all power player of this game, but there are things in place that balance it out pretty well. Some of the Predator's weapons have to be recharged, so just blasting away with the shoulder mounted plasma cannon is not advised.

Playing the Alien campaign the player is the creature that the scientist named “Six” - a poor captured Alien. The Wayland - Yutani company has some special plans for Six, oh the greed and nastiness of this company, who is the real monster here? Playing as an Alien requires a lot of tactical skill to fully utilize this character types natural defensive and attack capabilities. Claws, teeth and spiked tail and special senses. Sort of a natural enhanced sense mode that aids in seeing the prey. Blending with the darkness and easing in on a target is what the Alien does, or can attack in great numbers. Of course, the Alien can run along walls and ceiling, making it a very cool character to control indeed. As noted, darkness is your friend so, the Alien can also break light emanating sources, to plunge an area into darkness. Getting in close and personal is what the Alien does best. It's a good balance of character abilities and environment based survival abilities.

Other than the atmospheric single player campaigns there are several different multi player matches to be had in the game and all of them have something different to offer:

DEATH MATCH: A no brainer free for all, shoot everything that moves and survive to the end. Get the most kills in the set time limit, or get the target score before anyone else in the game.

SPECIES TEAM DEATH MATCH: Death match, only this time with teams. Marines, Vs Aliens,Vs Predator's. Get the most kills within the set time limit or reach the target score before any of the other teams.

MIXED SPECIES TEAM DEATH MATCH: Yup another death match. Get the most kills in the set time limit, or get the target score before anyone else in the game.

INFESTATION: Massive mayhem, sort of like zombie tag in many respects. One player starts out as an Alien. All the others are Marines, when a Marine is killed they come back in the game as another Alien. So as the name implies it's a race to stay alive and try not to be over whelmed, though being the last Marine standing in one of these matches is a thrill fest.

PREDATOR HUNT: Oh what fun, One player is selected as the Predator, sort of like king of the hill but not. Who ever kills the Predator get's to play as the Predator. Pretty fun all around.

DOMINATION: Two teams fight it out for control points all around the level. Keep a Control point and get a steady stream of points flowing in. Getting more Control Points and the team get more score.

SURVIVOR: The title says it all, four players enter the game and must fend off waves and waves of Aliens.

Over all Aliens Vs Predator has succeeded in bringing to the table so much newness with an old concept. It just does not get old anytime soon in it's playability.

reviewText:
Let me preface this with the important highlight that ~Multiplayer is DEAD~

Now that that's out the way... We have a slightly spooky romp of 4 hours or so through the Marine campaign where your IS IT IN THE VENTS OMG" fear of one alien is replaced with lets-kill-a-hundred-of-these-every-level after the initial 10 minutes.
The Alien campaign sucks
date: tearing 360° around the environment at lightning speeds is fun on F-Zero X
recommended:
not in a FPS while you're being shot at while completely disorientated.
Predator has potential but his storyline is one hour long and you never get the chance to really fight the swarthes of enemies his weaponry was just begging to tear up.

A dissapointing game that is worth <£4.99 of your time
hoursPlayed: the DX11 specular bump mapping does make for some shiny skinned aliens though I will admit."

reviewText:
Personally I loved playing this game especially being both an Alien fan and a predator fan. It doesn't quite have the impact the 1999 game had on me when I first played it, it is also less scary.

That being said, the multiplayer was fun, and the game did look very good. The predator was heavily upgraded and feels a little too over powered especially compared to the rest. In the original all characters were a pretty great balance. The prdator had the most interesting weapons and was sneaky (tactical), the alien was fast and semi strong (brawler) and the human was a run and gun character, that had the most powerful weapons but also was the easiest to kill since he's both restricted to ground and has limited tools of visibily when compared to alien and predator.

In this one, the alien seems very toned down (though still fast) while the predator is both beefed up, fast and great weapons. Humans remain great at using their guns, but they are still severally out gunned by predators and out paced by aliens.

8/10
