reviewText:
If you love: ALIENS, Marines and Predators (no notion towards the films Aliens or Predators) then you will love this, being a fan of the original Aliens Versus Predator classic and AVP2 games this game truly holds its own.

Levels are pretty repetitive in the design sense since the entire campaigns link together in a strong bond, but it’s a good repetitive point to make, go invisible as the Predator, climb up the walls as an Alien (exnomorph) or fire your pulse like you mean it as a Marine.

Now only if they used this engine to make Aliens: Colonial marine, just saying… Gearbox.

reviewText: Aliens vs predators did what Aliens colonial mariens failed to do. they delivered the intensity of the aliens movies with the acion of the predator movies. graphics by far are so much better as well as the Mechanics of the game. This game releashed in 2010 beats out alien colonial mariens which was releashed 2013. Youd think that three years would help improve the technology of graphics, story creativity, etc well in this case the 2006 game took the cake. having already played the first bit of the Marine campaign i can honsetly say it is the better of the two games. Im excited to play as a Xeno and predator soon. Cant wait to see how the stories come together in the end. im just really dissapointed with sega and gearbox having not created the master piece they promised with Aliens colonial mariens. Now with the design of the weapons and set pieces we see some differences because of copy right laws and so forth. Aliens CM was suppose to be as perfect and true to the film because they recieved rights to use audio, original set design to help produce the most authentic Alien game. It was suppose to have elements from the Second Alien game to help give you that feel of being there in the Alien universe but i just couldnt feel that when distracted with the crappy mechanics, gameplay, story etc within the game. In the end get Aliens VS Predators you will have a more enjoyable experiance and overall satisfaction. :D

reviewText:
Good graphic, good story, 3 sides, holding in suspense, Scary for marines, awakes our hunting senses playing as Predator, awaiting in shadows for it prey as Xen.

If that will (mostly) looks newest Aliens (Colonial Marine) this game could be a little pushed because AvP like previously AvP games is just short (5-6 levels per side)

Anyway game is heavy, with coop based multiplayer because of fighting system, easy to learn, hard to master and looks like - if you or your opponent in 1 on 1 battle do a counter attack you are already dead because you fall and before you stand up you're dead.

About single player - 3 sides walking through the same locations having almost common storyline but for sure they are linked together. Good game for playing with friends but some things like Survive mode could be better and there could be more coop modes. But still over 100 hours saying was worthy buying game.

It have that what AvP Game should have.

reviewText: I love this game.  It received many negative reviews, mainly regarding the control scheme.  I had no such problem with the controls, though.  Probably the definitive Aliens AND Predator game!  It brings together everything that's awesome about both franchises in a fun and sometimes challenging FPS.  The alien movements are far superior than the more recent Aliens Colonial Marines.  Wish online play was still an option, but that community trailed off long ago.  This is still worth owning for the campaign mode.\nAlso, finishing moves are always fun to perform and witness!  Impaling predators as an alien, or ripping  out marines' skulls as a predator never gets old.  You can quote me on that.

reviewText: This game is pretty good I guess. The marine campaign does have some serious issues with weapon balance though. I mean a direct hit with a grenade barely hurts an alien but then you get the sniper rifle which kills every alien in one hit? Oh well, at least the shotgun is awesome. The predators are so weak it's hilariously much easier to just evade all fights by cloaking and leaping around. Unfortunately half of the playing time is sucked up by scripted events and cutscenes so I just went back to playing F.E.A.R. instead.

reviewText:
The Aliens vs Predator games have always had mixed appeal for me. The original had wonderful atmosphere but I never enjoyed the gameplay, nominally because it had poor story but in truth because it so cheerfully kicked my ♥♥♥. The 2001 sequel had a stronger (if somewhat convoluted) story and I appreciated the gameplay more (read: it was easier) but -aside from a precious few moments- lacked the terrifying atmosphere that made the franchise so memorable. And what of the 2010 reboot?

Like the previous games, the series divides itself into three campaigns; one for each species (Human, Predator and Alien). The human campaign was suitably terrifying; I was vulnerable prey running from deadly and hungry non-terrestrial life. Unfortunately, my deadly array of weaponry even the odds somewhat, minimizing the fear... at least until ammo started to run low. But it was by far the best of the three campaigns.

The Alien and Predator campaigns were less satisfying; they were just too deadly to provide much of a challenge.  All three of the campaigns also suffered from very linear levels, although this was less obvious with the Aliens and Predators, who could leap across wide areas with ease, which opened up the maps somewhat; the Humans were limited to tight corridors. The story was improved over the 1999 game but was poorly paced and ended predictably. And the game was incredibly short; about two hours per campaign.

But for all its shortcomings, the old-school gameplay of Aliens vs Predator was a welcome change of pace. It might not have wowed" me
date: but neither did it entirely disappoint. It may have been run-of-the-mill as far as design
recommended: but it used the iconic franchise well and it was entertaining to boot.\n\nAvP 2010 got poor marks because it was constantly compared to its eleven-year old predecessor (a game which I did not care for); the 2010 edition is more akin to a modern corridor shooter like Call of Duty than the almost deathmatch-like first game. AVP 2010 is much more bound by its story and atmosphere
hoursPlayed: resulting in a more-tightly paced and scripted experience. Maybe this costs the game in replayability and unpredictability but it is something I found much more entertaining.\n\n"
voteText: November 27, 2013

reviewText: Τέλειο παιχνίδι δεν υπάρχει κι αυτό το γνωρίζουμε όλοι μας. Ως εκ τούτου, έχει και το συγκεκριμένο τα ψεγάδια του. Καταρχήν, είναι δυστυχώς πολύ μικρό στο single player κομμάτι του. Αυτό σίγουρα του αφαιρεί κάποιους πόντους από την συνολική αξία του. Επίσης, θα θέλαμε να έχουμε στη διάθεσή μας 2-3 όπλα ακόμη, ως marine, και μεγαλύτερη αποστολή ως Alien αλλά και Predator. Πρόβλημα υπάρχει και με την “Distract” λειτουργία του Predator, αλλά, εδώ που τα λέμε, αυτή δε θα σας χρειαστεί και πολύ, πλην ίσως λίγο στην αρχή. Σε γενικές γραμμές λοιπόν, τα μειονεκτήματά του είναι μάλλον λίγα. Συνολικά κρίνοντάς το, είναι ένα ποιοτικό παιχνίδι, που θα σας αφήσει θετικότατες εντυπώσεις και θα σας κάνει να περιμένετε την επόμενη συνέχεια της σειράς, καθότι στο φινάλε αφήνονται ξεκάθαρα υπονοούμενα για ένα ακόμη sequel! Ειδικά πάντως για τους fans των ταινιών, το παιχνίδι είναι must-have!

reviewText: Very cool game. Story mode offers three different characters to show you the overall plot from a different viewpoint; the rookie Marine handles like a FPS hero against the Xenomorphs, Alien experiment '6' strikes from the shadows to sow panic amongst the humans, and the young Predator hunter is a mix of stealth and brutal offense stalking both races. Completing every campaign will take you through almost all of the same levels, each with differing outcomes, but they all lead to a showdown and tease the same reveal at the end of the game. However, the inclusion of hidden collectibles for each race doesn't add much to the gameplay, except for the Marine. Imagine the audio-logs from Dead Space, but not as great (IMO, at least).

reviewText:
Aliens versus Predator is an interesting singleplayer game and a good-enough survival game. Providing three different perspectives in the Aliens versus Predator versus Marine triangle, you get a fairly interesting story that can keep you interested through at least one or two of the campaigns.

The survival mode is what keeps drawing me back as you try to fight your way through it all. Being one of the first major games to utilize Tessellation, it does very well with detail, but like most games that go this route it shows itself to be pretty but dumb.

It's good enough for a purchase, if on sale simply for experience sake, but don't fret about it too much if they're charging full price.

The multiplayer is still pretty active as of 11/2/2011 and is damn fun.

reviewText:
The Marine campaign has a bad storyline, voice acting, script, characters. On the other hand you have a pretty good Predator and Alien campaign that makes up for it. Another annoying thing is that the people on the comms constantly tell you to go go go. What's the rush? I'm trying to listen to an audio log FFS. I recommend skipping the Marine storyline and play everything else. The graphics are beautiful also. The music is lackluster. The AI is a joke.

Weapons that make the game good:
+M56 Smartgun
+M41A/2 Pulse Rifle
+ZX-76 Shotgun
+VP78 Pistol (secondary fire all the way)
+UA 571-C Automated Sentry Gun
-M42C Scoped Rifle
-Flamethrower (almost useless)

reviewText:
If you love: ALIENS, Marines and Predators (no notion towards the films Aliens or Predators) then you will love this, being a fan of the original Aliens Versus Predator classic and AVP2 games this game truly holds its own.

Levels are pretty repetitive in the design sense since the entire campaigns link together in a strong bond, but it’s a good repetitive point to make, go invisible as the Predator, climb up the walls as an Alien (exnomorph) or fire your pulse like you mean it as a Marine.

Now only if they used this engine to make Aliens: Colonial marine, just saying… Gearbox.

reviewText:
an amazing game well made and extremly loyal to the previous games,
even though it does not surpass the best AvP game of all time Avp 2 with its expansion AvP 2: Primal hunt

reviewText:
Me personally got an extreme amoount of fun out of the game, the 3 campaigns are long but not TOO long and, well, there are three of them, Marine, who use guns and flamethrowers, aliens, small sneaky creatures that, even in multyplayer can give you a heart attack and climb walls, and last but not least the predator, a slightly OP tribal warrior like humanoid.


I havent played too much with predator and marine (+- 2 hours combined) but i do know that this is what should happen: aliens pick on marine, marine pick on predator and predator. this is what happens: aliens and pretator pick on marine, marine stay in groups trying too survive constant waves of predators and usually fail, predators jump high places end snipe everyone with their laser-thing and aliens and predators nearly never pick a fight with each other god know why.


The maps are well balenced with a combination of shadows (where aliens ACTUALLY become near impossible too see) and open light areas where the rest kinda hangs out afraid of getting 2 shotted by an alien/predator. There is even a map /labirinth where the wals constantly move and sometimes kill you.


I recommend beieng an alien if you like too be sneaky-assasin like and enjoy trolling/giving people heart attacks, every time i sneak up un a marine i imagine i scared them to death >:), predator is a more up-in-yo-face type of class, it has some one shot weopons lieing around the map and can jump stupidly high, i recommend beieng a predator if you like meleeing someone to death and sometimes just blast someone to hell with a laser, and last (and honestly least) marine, i recommend marine for people who like hanging back, torching people with flamethrowers, shotgun and gun alike. warning though, this IS the easyest class too play, but, the NR1. class to pick upon, if you choose this class, rage awaits you.


Do i  reccomend this game, HELL YES, for +- 15 euros this game is like finding a lump of gold the size of, lemme think, an  ELEPHANT this game might look old but the grafics are stunning and the atmoshere is terrefieing and absolutely awesome at the same time and everything is extremely polished.

reviewText: While I recommend this, it's minimally so.  I won this game in an offsite and I have to say, I was sort of curious about it.  Getting it free was a bonus.  There isn't much in the way of gameplay.  All three campaigns can be wrapped up quite quickly, but I still rate things like movies.  If I'm willing to spend $15 for 1.5 to 2 hrs of entertainment, I shouldn't be upset for the same level of entertainment from a game.  (Then again, I'm a cheapskate and I only do matinee for $5.50).  Even if you are a cheapskate like me, I had fun for 5 hrs, so that would translate to $27.50.  I'm good.

reviewText: This game is great from when it was made (2010) and now (2015). Humans might seem like they're at a disadvantage but actually if you use them right (e.g block then shoot the heck outta it) then you'll get big scores. Aliens are at the top of behind E kills (grapple kills which you cant escape from) which can be annoying but since the Aliens are'nt as good in open melee they kinda have to rely on it. Now the Predators they for me are the most fun race to play as they can also perform E kills from behind but why would anyone want to do that sure some cool animations come from it but the best ones come from the front after wounding your enemy so much they cant fight back also they get cool gear like the plasma mine, combi stick and even the plasma cannon which is a bit op. So what im trying to say it this game is great and you should absouletly get this whenever you have enough money. Also REVIVE MULTIPLAYER

reviewText: This game wasn't bad, just not quite as good as I was hoping. All three compaigns were relatively fun and varied, but hampered by some control and gameplay errors. As other reviewers have realized, the marine campaign has the most effort. Only a few problems with them,  such as the inability to switch guns by rolling the mouse. You have to press numbers, and I died countless times while trying to switch in the heat of the battle and pressing the wrong button because I didn't know which gun was 2 or 3. There is also no aim button, and a crouch isn't present either, both dumb exclusions. The campaign is relatively long, if forgettable and muddled. The Alien campaign is super short and the predator is relatively short. The jumping to new ground button with the predator doesn't really work, and is the same button for locking on to attack someone. This is a dumb idea and you usually do the one you aren't trying to.

reviewText:
In 2010 I got this game: Joined the game as Alien, kept thinking there was an alien running after me, realized it was my own tail.  Spent 1 hour chasing my own tail 10/10.
___________________________

An incredibly underrated game which did not deserve the hate it got because it was not the clone of a 10+ years old game that played like Doom on speed or because of a few graphical glitches which were quickly patched after the game came out. And let's not forget people whining about the lack of crouch for the Marine or Predator (seems fair to rate a game 1/10 if it doesn't have the one feature you want).

As many of the people here, I was really into AvP since the first comics were published and I played pretty much every single game ever made for it (from the capcom arcades up to the transition to PC and consoles) and now even own the AvP boardgame. So you can trust me when I say I know what AvP is about
date: and I have seen what games can do for it".\n\nEach game brings its own unique ideas to the franchise
hoursPlayed: so rather than listing all the things you can do in this game (which you can easily read from other reviews)
voteText: I am going to post what new ideas and moods the game brings.\n\nUnlike its predecessors
helpfulPercent: you do not feel like your character is an helium balloon sliding on oil
votesHelpful: they finally feel like they have WEIGHT and a real presence within the world (with being able to look at your own body).\nRunning around mindlessly and shooting is not how you play it
votesTotal: with predator is all about being Stealthy and knowing your surroundings
votesFunny: finding the right spots and switch
commentsCount: with the Marine is about aim and paying attention to details studying your opponents behaviours
column16: with the Alien is about hiding
column18: waiting for opportunities and taking chances. The fact that a few environments are interactive
column19: forces you to change your strategy with interesting results.\n\nI often find that people who get annoyed at the multiplayer of this game are those who expect it to play like a game of Team Fortress
column20: I for one am happy it plays NOTHING like it
column21: and I wouldn't if it was as frantic
column22: chaotic and "floaty" as that game. I like that I have a sense of understanding of what is happening around me.\n\nTo this day
column23: it is a shame this game does not have a sequel because AvP2010 is the game who came closest to understanding what the AvP franchise are all about."

reviewText:
In 2010 I got this game: Joined the game as Alien, kept thinking there was an alien running after me, realized it was my own tail.  Spent 1 hour chasing my own tail 10/10.
___________________________

An incredibly underrated game which did not deserve the hate it got because it was not the clone of a 10+ years old game that played like Doom on speed or because of a few graphical glitches which were quickly patched after the game came out. And let's not forget people whining about the lack of crouch for the Marine or Predator (seems fair to rate a game 1/10 if it doesn't have the one feature you want).

As many of the people here, I was really into AvP since the first comics were published and I played pretty much every single game ever made for it (from the capcom arcades up to the transition to PC and consoles) and now even own the AvP boardgame. So you can trust me when I say I know what AvP is about
date: and I have seen what games can do for it".\n\nEach game brings its own unique ideas to the franchise
hoursPlayed: so rather than listing all the things you can do in this game (which you can easily read from other reviews)
voteText: I am going to post what new ideas and moods the game brings.\n\nUnlike its predecessors
helpfulPercent: you do not feel like your character is an helium balloon sliding on oil
votesHelpful: they finally feel like they have WEIGHT and a real presence within the world (with being able to look at your own body).\nRunning around mindlessly and shooting is not how you play it
votesTotal: with predator is all about being Stealthy and knowing your surroundings
votesFunny: finding the right spots and switch
commentsCount: with the Marine is about aim and paying attention to details studying your opponents behaviours
column16: with the Alien is about hiding
column18: waiting for opportunities and taking chances. The fact that a few environments are interactive
column19: forces you to change your strategy with interesting results.\n\nI often find that people who get annoyed at the multiplayer of this game are those who expect it to play like a game of Team Fortress
column20: I for one am happy it plays NOTHING like it
column21: and I wouldn't if it was as frantic
column22: chaotic and "floaty" as that game. I like that I have a sense of understanding of what is happening around me.\n\nTo this day
column23: it is a shame this game does not have a sequel because AvP2010 is the game who came closest to understanding what the AvP franchise are all about."

reviewText: This game wasn't bad, just not quite as good as I was hoping. All three compaigns were relatively fun and varied, but hampered by some control and gameplay errors. As other reviewers have realized, the marine campaign has the most effort. Only a few problems with them,  such as the inability to switch guns by rolling the mouse. You have to press numbers, and I died countless times while trying to switch in the heat of the battle and pressing the wrong button because I didn't know which gun was 2 or 3. There is also no aim button, and a crouch isn't present either, both dumb exclusions. The campaign is relatively long, if forgettable and muddled. The Alien campaign is super short and the predator is relatively short. The jumping to new ground button with the predator doesn't really work, and is the same button for locking on to attack someone. This is a dumb idea and you usually do the one you aren't trying to.

reviewText:
I've played through this multiple times and I have finally come to a conclusion.

Artificial Intelligence
The marines are beyond stupid, they show no recognition of each others existence and they show no emotion when they discover that one of there comrades has mysteriously and violently died. The Alien AI is also pretty stupid, they run directly towards you or they run up a wall only to jump back down again.

Marine Campaign
The Marine campaign consists of walking around empty corridors and reaching marines moments after they die proving that the AI is so unbelievably stupid that the developers have to kill them all off using scripted events, there's no point going into detail about the Marine campaign because its really really generic. If you were looking for a Colonial Marines Squad experience you're out of luck because you spend the entire campaign on your own. Also a fellow Marine called Tequila talks into your ear for most of the game and she will annoy the hell out of you.

Alien Campaign
The Alien Campaign starts off quite promising but quickly goes downs hill when you meet the mentally challenged Marines who have no knowledge of each others existence, so you spend the entire campaign scuttling about killing off Marines one by one until the game tells you that you've won.

Predator Campaign
The Predator Campaign is really really boring, you simply jump about killing off mentally challenged Marines and having the occasional fight against a group of Aliens using disorientating melee attacks.

Multiplayer
The multiplayer is a tiny tiny tiny little bit better than the singleplayer but not something I would pay money for. The multiplayer maps are really small and most of them are recycled from the singleplayer. The multiplayer is almost dead and the currently being attacked by hackers.

Overall
I can't believe that people are calling this the best game ever because its awful compared to its predecessor Alien vs Predator 2. If you want a real AvP experience then go play Alien vs Predator 2 because its a fantastic game that has stood the test of time.

Still better than Aliens: Colonial Marines.

reviewText:
I can't say that I recommend the game.  If you were a big fan of the series perhaps you would enjoy it, but then wouldn't you already own it by now?  Additionally, just because the most dedicated fans may enjoy something, certainly does not make it good.

I bought this game on sale, thinking it would be a fun FPS to run through, but it really wasn't.

ProsNo FPS lock
Dated graphics still look reasonableConsVery little exploring or problem solving.  The game just has you run waypoint to waypoint killing dozens of ailens along the way.
The aliens don't feel scary or difficult, rather, it's just a difficulty factor based on how many shotgun shells I have left.
The game basically plays like a bad version of Doom 3 or even Dead Space
The guns are uninteresting.  This is the future and my rifle doesn't have a semi-automatic setting?
I got so sick of hearing that Michelle Rodriguez sound-a-like call me rookie" and boss me around.
Why do flashlights from the future make a weird sound when being turned off and on?  My flashlights are dead silent.  To my memory
date: the flashlights from the Alien movies were silent as well."

reviewText:
The campaign is way too short compared to its predeccesor Alien vs Predator 2. I finished the Alien campaign in less than 2 hours. I've finished the Alien campaign and will add more stuff when I finish the Predator and Human campaigns. This felt like a cheap way to mooch off the AvP franchise name without putting in any effort to create a game. 6 hours to finish 3 campaigns who reuse the same exact maps is just too fast.

Bought it on the Steam Sale for $7.50.

PROS
1. Interesting Franchise
I mean it's AvP. There are a lot of interesting weapons and technology in the lore.

CONS
1. Short Campaign
Way too short.

2. Uninteresting Campaign
The campaign is pretty uninteresting compared to AvP 2. In AvP 2, you actually start off as a Facehugger having to find your first victim, followed by being a Chestburster and feeding on dogs then finally ending off as a Xenomorph. This just starts off as the Alien doing repetitive actions.

Press E to do an overly complex action before you kill the creature.

3. Alien Movement
Clunky to say the least. You have to keep holding down Mouse 3 in order to run around smoothly. The view is also limited as you can't turn 360 to see your surroundings when you're hiding on top.

4. View
No more Alien pheromone view. It's just normal mode with enemies highlighted Red, Blue and Yellow. You kill Red and Blues and harvest Yellows and they have to be in your line of sight.

5. Enemies
♥♥♥♥ poor variety. Only a machine gunner and a flame thrower for human varieties. Predators were seriously weak, a jump attack and a heavy attack, rinse repeat.

6. Human Weapons
A Rifle with a grenade launcher, a flamethrower, a shotgun, a sniper rifle, a pistol and a smart gun. Where's the rocket launcher, plasma rifle, rail gun and your hand grenade?

7. Predator Weapons
What happened to the Crossbow to rip heads off?
Why is the spinning disc so weak? It's like a toy ball.
Where is the multi-targetting system in infra-red?
How did the Predator staff become so strong and teleport back into your hands after each attack?

reviewText:
I have a hard time recommending this game. I am a fan of the Alien-license (not a hardcore one that would notice plot inconsistencies, mind you) and picked this up on a Steam sale, and I just don't feel like playing any more of it. For reference, I only beat the Marine campaign and some of the Predator campaign so far, and I don't think I'll go and beat both that and the Alien campaign any time soon. Each campaign seems like it'll last you about 2-3 hours, considering I beat the Marine one in about 2 hours and felt like I got halfway through the Predator one.

Its not that I feel that I didn't get my money's worth with Aliens vs Predator (I paid, like, five dollars for it), but I think its not something you should get excited about playing. It works, the environments can be pretty, and it does feel like an Alien game, but the scenarios are bland and not very exciting, and the weapons feel like toys and aren't very satisfying to kill enemies with.

A linear, story-driven FPS needs more than just enemies that you point and shoot at. This genre requires satisfying gunplay mechanics and scenarios that give you an adrenaline rush, or make you feel tense. There have to be challenging rooms filled with enemies that come out of every corner, and you should feel awesome once you overcome that challenge!

Aliens vs Predator is so unexciting that even dying on harder difficulties didn't get me frustrated or angry - I just didn't care enough. At first I thought it was because I was playing the Marine campaign, but the few minutes I played of the Predator campaign were even worse. Again, its not that the game is awful or unplayable, but there are so many other story-driven FPS games that play better. Not every game can be Half-Life, Bioshock or Wolfenstein: The New Order, but a game this mediocre just isn't fun to play nowadays.

reviewText:
Half decent shooter, but can easily be missed. Overall gameplay is too simplistic, corridor shooter at its worst. Couldn't get more linear as even previously explored areas get cut off for not reason. Simplistic AI, which becomes a real weakness during hunter missions (as Alien or as Predator).
Marine missions: incredibly basic and kinda boring. Weapons feel useless and clumsy.
Alien missions: by far the best part of the game, rather fun.
Predator missions: underdeveloped, especially as the available arsenal and abilities are very diverse. Plasma caster gets little use, first due to lack of ammo, later on due to much better weapons.
Really dislike the inability to break actions like taunt kills or using objects.
Pointless storyline, with ending that makes everything seems futile.
Compared to AvP 2 from 2001 made by Monolith, this is a definite loser.

reviewText:
Buy when it's: $3.75.

Let's get this out of the way: AVP2 from 2001 is still the best. So how does this 2010 reboot fare?

STORY: Barebones.

All 3 races share the same storyline, so mostly it's just perspective and gameplay that changes. There's some planet, another Weyland android tries to capture aliens to get their technology. Go kill each other. Yeah, story's pretty weak.

LEVEL DESIGN: Good variety but reused a lot.

Most of the maps will be the exact same for all 3 campaigns, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Each level is actually designed to be navigated in different ways depending on your species: the Aliens will go around walls and through vents, the Predators will hop across distances and heights, while Humans will walk horizontally.

PREDATOR GAMEPLAY: Fun, but not many combat options.

You wish you could toy with your prey more, but the game encourages you to go fist-to-fist. You only get the diskus and the combistick (which can only be thrown) very late in the game, so most of the time, you're just trying to stealth and sneak behind for a quick dramatic kill. It also sucks that you get UNLIMITED CLOAKING, which takes away the suspense of running out of power at exactly the last second.

MARINE GAMEPLAY: Good atmosphere, but few weapons.

I love the level where you try to escape from a Night Club. You never see this in a space horror game: you're the last survivor trying to get out of a failed rescue mission, and then ... the music blasts, so you're fighting off hordes of aliens while dancing to the music. Unfortunately, you're stuck using the very basic autorifle or pistol most of the time, with the shotgun, flamethrower, and smartgun making an extrance very late in the game.

ALIENS GAMEPLAY: Short, and feels weak.

You don't have the Press E for pounce" anymore. Instead
date: you have to hold SHIFT and target an enemy in order to leap onto them. Attacks also feel clunky
recommended: and not fluid. You only play as a regular alien drone
hoursPlayed: never a facehugger

reviewText: This game is somewhat underrated. I agree that the three campaigns are really short (2-4 hours each!), but change the difficulty to hard, and I promise you your heath will be pumping (if you die you'll have to start all over). I had a lot of fun completing this game on hard, and the campaigns also seem somewhat longer, since you can't just charge in and kill everything. For the current price the single player is well worth it, since it catches the alien, predator, human aspects pretty well.\n\nThe multiplayer part could have been fun, but it just seems somehow unbalanced. Either way, multiplayer is close to dead. This also means that you have no chance to get all the achievements, since you'll need 18060 XP for one of them, and you don't earn a lot of XP in each match. Also, don't buy the map pack (since noone is playing).

reviewText:
Singleplayer:

The game is amazing especially since your not just one race, you get to play all 3 and each has its own story. I went from Humans to Predators to Aliens and found the Aliens a bit disappointing. Compared to the humans and predators, the Alien campaign was like half the length.

Multiplayer:

DO NOT BUY THE DLC. The DLC is made for multiplayer and multiplayer alone. Why do i say not buy it? Because the online is DEAD. There is no one in ranked or player matches, i was the only one searching for a game so don't waste your money on the DLC unless you plan on doing the survivor maps with friends.

Overall:

Pretty good game besides there being no one playing online so do not buy it at the price its at now, wait for a sale because all your getting is the campaign. Story alone is amazing and i got a good amount of hours out of it, you can go back and play on a harder difficulty if you want or get the achievements which i plan on doing later.

reviewText:
The single player is boring.
It does not have any variety or adds anything new to make it interesting.
All Campaigns share the same story which while interesting story mode is very slow paced and mostly filler to make the game seem longer.

Multiplayer is hard to find matches, and when you do you get lots of hackers cheating and even so the Predators are the most strongest species, while Aliens and Marines are struggles trying to fight against any Predator player. Marines are also way too slow and have hardly any health and all characters constantly lose their balance when melee, making it very hard to get back up or have a fighting chance. SEGA does not update or even fixes any of the game's issues. And the game lags horribly, and almost unplayable due to how much lag the servers have. Steam also does nothing to get rid of cheaters so this gets a bad score and not reccomended.

IF THIS IS ON SALE DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! IF IT IS AT $3 DO NOT. EVEN IF THE GAME IS GIVEN AS A GIFT OR IS FREE STAY AWAY FROM IT! UNLESS STEAM OR SEGA WANT TO FIX THE GAME'S PROBLEMS THEN MAYBE THE GAME IS WORTH A FEW CENTS.

reviewText:
This is absolutely awesome game with fun factor and replayability equal to the first one from 1999

Pros:
+ Great graphics while not very system demanding
+ Detailed character models with realistic animation
+ Motion blur effect hated by some can be turned off
+ Good music
+ Quality FPS mechanics with all species
+ Very good level design
+ Variable difficulty setting for all kinds of players, extremely challenging on nightmare
+ Online Multiplayer with many types of gameplay modes
+ Well done survival maps for additional gameplay or training
+ Balanced characters
+ Immersive story
+ Digitalized Lance Henriksen voiced by the original

Cons(details really, nothing gamebreaking):
-annyoing NPCs in marine campaign
-Predator character unneccessarily dual wields wrist blades, making him bit more butcher than a hunter
-Alien behavior sometimes contradicts the movies, like when they don't avoid fire or attack impregnated NPC

Let me just warn you, while this is an action game, it's definitely not for players who like to grab a chaingun and chew through enemy hordes, but if you like tactical FPS and/or survival horrors, you will enjoy Marine and stealth gameplay fans will love playing for the extraterrestials.

10 out of 10

reviewText:
Is there not ONE Aliens game worth a damn out of them all? Heard this was pretty good, reviews say pretty good, IMO not very good. This game goes out of it's way to punish players even on Easy, for it's time the graphics were amazing but the playability really does a critical hit to the games fun factor, also on a sidenote the game can never decide how many shots it will take to kill any random target, sometimes it takes one headshot from a pistol, the same enemy might take 3 shotgun blasts to the face to kill 2 mins later, this might be good if they can patch it for balance but if you got this for a solo campaign like I did just save your $ this thing needs a lot of help I am pretty sure it will never get.

Story 1.0 Wasn't worth playing after 80min of the Marine campaign.

Graphics 8.0 For it's day these were epic graphics, and even today better than some.

Playability : 1.0 Not sure who did the balancing but they should be fired and never allowed in the gaming industry ever again, Marine runs like he has a load of ♥♥♥♥ in his pants with forgettable random damage weapons that fluxuates wildly from alien to alien.

Was hoping for a gem came up with another failed attempt at a movie license game. 2.0 / 10

reviewText:
Only played as the MArine so far so here is my take....

Scarier than Alien Isolation.  However as I've not played Isolation this is nothing more than a theory so here is why I think its scarier.
In Alien Isolation as soon as you are spotted you are dead.  THis make the game scary to a point then it becomes frustration.
As a Marine in AvsP the ALiens feel like they are stalking you which builds tension ala ALien Isolation, they don't rush at you immediately, they slowly surround you before attacking. They are hard to spot in dark areas which cause quite a few unscripted jump scares but when you are spotted you have a good chance of survival... assuming you don't run out of ammo.
They also avoid attacks which took me by supprise and their speed is incredible. You can't really hide, you have to fight but you can run away and if you do they seem to go back into stalking mode, slowly homing in on your position.

However until I play Isolation this is all theory based on gameplay footage and playing this game.

So far the pistol is what I have used the most due to the low amounts of ammo in game. This adds a further dimention of tension to the game which Aliens Isolation can't match. Is it a better game than ALien Isolation?  Maybe not, it just feels ever so slightly empty like older FPS game do. Like the original games do so I was suprised when the NPC's I met did not die immediately!

Is it as good as Colonial Marines?   not sure, the two games are so very different. Its a lot less buggy so far and a bit more polished but ALiens Colonial Marines feels less empty/more alive and is more fun to play.

Overall I would say buy it even if its just for the Marine campaign and expect a more Resident evil approach to the game play (as in PS1) as this is more a survival horror game than a FPS shooter.

reviewText:
Excellent action. Would be beauty if it was not for check points, instead of save games.

It takes getting used to, even though it's wasd, and not much else. Re-map 'sprint' if you buy it. (It's Q, so change it to 'shift'.) I needed to up the gamma, otherwise it's a dark nightmare. A touch of gamma brings it alive.

I played the marine missions. Alien and pred. yet to do. Easy worth the £2.50 sale price I paid, just to play marine. It takes you to the alien killing world, gives you that movie assault rifle. The shotgun is there too.

I think I will play the predator mission, as it was good fun in the first game ten or so years ago.

Good game, spoiled by checkpoints, but wins you back with many good moments, and some worthwhile sets.

reviewText: Se avete amato la serie Alien, come me, o Predator non potete lasciarvi sfuggire il titolo dei Rebellion (eccezzionale il loro primo Alien VS Predator 2000). Lo consiglio vivamente ai miei amici, per l'atmosfera cupa e greve, per la campagna in sigle del marine (le altre sono meno belle anche se vivi la stessa storia dal punto di vista xenomorfo e predatore), ma soprattutto per le furibonde sfide in multiplayer a squadre. Spero che molti dei miei amici lo acquistino, per poterci massacrare in multi. Il mio sogno nel cassetto sarebbe proprio fare una squadra di marine amici, che ripulisce le mappe in compagnia. Il gioco non vede una rappresentanza italiana degnamente rappresentata e mi tocca giocare in multi con russi e altri di paesi dell'est europa. Escono dalle fottute pareti" venite

reviewText: I started playing this game again after getting it a year ago and I think it's definetly underrated. It's multiplayer is actually a lot of fun. You can be an alien, predator, or human and neither of them feel underpowered. The single player allows you to play from all 3 races in any order you want and they all have some simple controls to pull off some class Alien or Predator horror movie style kills. The graphics are pretty good too. I'd give this a shot if you had $30 to spare.

reviewText:
If you like spines getting ripped out by ♥♥♥♥♥-head and pokey-mouth aliens, then this is the game for you.



In all seriousness, I bought this game upon release in 2010, and upon revisiting it, it still holds up quite nicely. Graphics are still pretty impressive. Gameplay is simple, but fun. AI can be a bit iffy, but it never really bothered me. Plot is also straightforward and simple, but still better than either AvP film. All in all, there isnt any better I wanna be an Alien or Predator and kill things" game out right now.

9/10 - A must-have for AvP fans"

reviewText: While it's a little too easy to perform sync kills on players in multiplayer, the single-player campaigns are great and extremely atmospheric. I'd even go so far as to say that the games are better than the Alien" "Predator" movies themselves. Of the three races
recommended: the Xenomorph (my favorite) lost the most in this updated version. It's more easily  countered by the Colonial Marine and the Predator
hoursPlayed: and since it only has melee options for combat
